actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of the Congress concerning the public health implications of marketing campaigns and petitions by cigarette manufactures to remove barriers to cigarette sales and advertising.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the export of U.S. tobacco products is an international health issue rather than an international trade issue; (2) the Federal Government should not engage in negotiations to force Thailand to allow the importation of foreign cigarettes and to rescind laws banning cigarette advertisements; and (3) United States Trade Representative should reject any petition of the United States Cigarette Export Association requiring a foreign country to accept cigarette sales practices that are not permitted here.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of the Congress concerning the public health implications of marketing campaigns and petitions by cigarette manufactures to remove barriers to cigarette sales and advertising.
